result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Nicholas J Scott in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF42, 16CT21, 17CF9, 17CF29.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1 in 17CF29, Ct 2 & Ct 3 in 16CF42 and Ct 1 in 16CT21.  All other counts will be dismissed and read-in along with charges in 17CF9.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1 in 17CF29, Ct 2 & Ct 3 in 16CF42 and Ct 1 in 16CT21.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 in 17CF29, Ct 2 & Ct 3 in 16CF42 and Ct 1 in 16CT21.  BY THE COURT:  All other charges/counts are to be dismissed and read-in along with charges in 17CF9.
Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.
BY THE COURT: 

16CT21 - Ct 1:  Pay fine and costs of $379.00.  Submit DNA sample and pay the $200.00 surcharge.  

17CF29 - Ct 1:  Serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any sentence currently serving.  May be served in Sauk County.  Sentence to commence on or before 10/26/17 at 7:00 p.m., report clean and sober.  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.  *Credit for 7 days already served.  

16CF42 - Ct 2:  Serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any sentence currently serving.  May be served in Sauk County.  Sentence to commence on or before 10/26/17 at 7:00 p.m., report clean and sober.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.  

16CF42 - Ct 3:  Serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any sentence currently serving.  May be served in Sauk County.  Sentence to commence on or before 10/26/17 at 7:00 p.m., report clean and sober.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

**Bond to be applied; however, the bond of $1500.00 is to be applied last and the balance returned to poster. 
 
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Return date on June 22, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas J Scott in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
*16CF42, 16CT21, 17CF9 & 17CF29 tracking together.
 Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
bond continued
  Return date scheduled for June 22, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
BY THE COURT:  All matters will track together - 16CF42, 16CT21, 17CF9 tracking with 17CF29
